103236.name: A Light in the Darkness
103236.flavorText: Wait, how can you have a light in the dark? If you turn on a light while it’s dark, doesn’t that mean it’s no longer dark?

102547.name: Acidmaw
102547.text: Whenever an enemy minion takes damage, destroy it.
102547.flavorText: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!

106559.name: Acolyte of Pain
106559.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.
106559.flavorText: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.

102529.name: Addled Grizzly
102529.text: After you summon a Beast, give it +1/+1.
102529.flavorText: Druids who spend too long in bear form are more susceptible to the whispers of the Old Gods. Right now they are whispering the lyrics to "La Bamba".

102634.name: Al'Akir, the Winds of Time
102634.flavorText: Murozond sought unlikely allies in his fight against the Bronze Dragonflight.

103242.name: Alley Armorsmith
103242.text: Taunt Whenever this minion deals damage, gain that much Armor.
103242.flavorText: The rent is cheap and she passes the savings onto YOU!

102655.name: Ancient Shieldbearer
102655.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain 10 Armor.
102655.flavorText: Back in her day, each shield weighed two tons and she had to carry four of them on each arm!

102612.name: Anub'arak
102612.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/4 Nerubian with "Deathrattle: Summon Anub'arak."
102612.flavorText: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.

102531.name: Aviana
102531.flavorText: Call her "Tweety". She'll find it real funny. I PROMISE.

103241.name: Axe Flinger
103241.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
103241.flavorText: Once a lowly "Stick Flinger", he's been relentless on the path to his ultimate dream: "Tauren Flinger".

102681.name: Aya Blackpaw
102681.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Summon a Jade Golem. Battlecry and Deathrattle: Summon a Jade Golem.
102681.flavorText: Though young, Aya took over as the leader of Jade Lotus through her charisma and strategic acumen when her predecessor was accidentally crushed by a jade golem.

102544.name: Ball of Spiders
102544.text: Summon three 1/1 Webspinners with "Deathrattle: Get a random Beast."

103226.name: Bane of Doom
103226.text: Deal 3 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
103226.flavorText: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

102564.name: Black Morass Imposter
102564.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random 2-Cost minion that gains Spell Damage +1.
102564.flavorText: Does something seem off about Medivh's apprentice to you?

103232.name: Blackwing Corruptor
103232.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 5 damage.
103232.flavorText: He got his name when he gave Blackwing some comic books and rock & roll records.

102611.name: Blade of C'Thun
102611.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion. Add its Attack and Health to your C'Thun's (wherever it is).
102611.flavorText: C'Thun demands a sacrifice! Preferably a Deathwing.

102659.name: Blast from the Past
102659.text: Get 2 Spare Parts. Summon two 1/1 Boom Bots. Shuffle a Bomb into your opponent's deck.

103228.name: Bouncing Blade
103228.text: Deal 1 damage to a random minion. Repeat until a minion dies.
103228.flavorText: Only goblins would think this was a good idea. Even they are starting to have their doubts.

103229.name: Brass Knuckles
103229.text: After your hero attacks, give a random minion in your hand +1/+1.
103229.flavorText: For the goon that wants to make a fashion statement.

102579.name: Bronze Dragonknight
102579.text: Taunt. Battlecry: If this has 5 or more Attack, summon a copy of this.
102579.flavorText: He had been here before, and in some ways, he would always be fighting in Silithus.

102607.name: Burgle
102607.text: Get 3 random cards (from your opponent's class).

102680.name: C'Thun
102680.text: Battlecry: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack randomly split among all enemies.
102680.flavorText: C'Thun's least favorite Hearthstone card: Eye for an Eye.

102669.name: C'Thun's Chosen
102669.text: Divine Shield Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +3/+3 (wherever it is).
102669.flavorText: He gave her a promise ring and everything.

102562.name: Cabalist's Tome
102562.flavorText: What's in there? I bet it's cookie recipes!

102628.name: Call in the Finishers
102628.flavorText: When you really need a job done… but you don't really care if it gets done right.

102538.name: Cenarion Hold
102538.text: Your next Choose One card this turn has both effects combined.
102538.flavorText: After the War of the Shifting Sands, Cenarion Hold became a strategic outpost, awaiting the moment when the armies of C'Thun would rise once again.

102646.name: Chamber of Viscidus
102646.text: Look at 3 cards in your hand and choose one to discard. Draw two cards.

103224.name: Charged Hammer
103224.flavorText: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.

102648.name: Cho'gall
102648.text: Battlecry: Return all cards you discarded this game to your hand. They cost Health instead of Mana.
102648.flavorText: Even after all this time, Gul'dan still makes Cho'gall go get donuts and coffee.

102568.name: Chromie, Timehopper
102568.text: Battlecry: Visit a Historical Epoch. Shuffle the others into your deck.
102568.flavorText: "Noz, you're telling me you built a time machine...out of a Hearthstone card?"

103196.name: Cobra Shot
103196.text: Deal 3 damage to a minion and the enemy hero.
103196.flavorText: "Cobra Shot" hurts way, way, way more than "Cobra Cuddle."

102597.name: Confessor Paletress
102597.text: Battlecry and Inspire: Summon a random Legendary minion.
102597.flavorText: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears. Most common fear: Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

105566.name: Convert
105566.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand. It costs (1).

102675.name: Crazed Worshipper
102675.text: Taunt Whenever this minion takes damage, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
102675.flavorText: Every month they share a pancake breakfast with the Perfectly Rational Worshippers.

103233.name: Cult Apothecary
103233.text: Battlecry: For each enemy minion, restore 2 Health to your hero.

102554.name: Dalaran Aspirant
102554.flavorText: Is he aspiring or inspiring? Make up your mind!

103194.name: Dark Arakkoa
103194.flavorText: There's a whole gradient of Arakkoa! This one is on the darker side.

102643.name: Dark Bargain
102643.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.
102643.flavorText: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.

102609.name: Dark Iron Skulker
102609.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all undamaged enemy minions.
102609.flavorText: He loves skulking. He skulks after hours just for the joy of it, but his friends are pretty worried he'll get burnt out.

102639.name: Dark Peddler
102639.flavorText: I'm offering you a bargain here! This amazing vacuum cleaner for your soul!

102638.name: Darkbomb
102638.text: Deal 3 damage to a character. If it dies, draw a Shadow spell.
102638.flavorText: If you're looking to make an "Emo" deck, this card is perfect!

103218.name: Darkshire Alchemist
103218.flavorText: The secret ingredient: liquified funnel cake.

102636.name: Demonfuse
102636.flavorText: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.

102671.name: Disciple of C'Thun
102671.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage. Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
102671.flavorText: C’Thun’s recruiting pitch involves cookies, which is why it’s the most popular Old God.

102567.name: Disco at the End of Time
102567.text: Cast 5 random Secrets from the past. At the start of your turn, destroy them.
102567.flavorText: This is what you've been saving the last dance for.

102682.name: Don Han'Cho
102682.text: Battlecry: Give a random minion in your hand +5/+5.
102682.flavorText: The brilliant mastermind of the Grimy Goons, Han sometimes thinks about ditching the idiot Cho, but that would just tear him apart.

102548.name: Dreadscale
102548.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all enemies.
102548.flavorText: Let's be clear about this: ACIDMAW is the sidekick.

102549.name: Durnholde Imposter
102549.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random 3-Cost minion that gains Poisonous.
102549.flavorText: Assassins of the Infinite Dragonflight waited for their moment to strike at Thrall before he ever became Warchief.

102677.name: Emperor Thaurissan
102677.text: At the end of your turn, reduce the Cost of cards in your hand by (1).
102677.flavorText: His second greatest regret is summoning an evil Firelord who enslaved his entire people.

102576.name: Enter the Coliseum
102576.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.
102576.flavorText: You have to get past the vendors first. So many are lost to shopping...

102545.name: Explorer's Hat
102545.text: Give a minion +1/+1 and "Deathrattle: Get an Explorer's Hat."
102545.flavorText: Harrison Jones was disappointed that he didn't get to be part of the League of Explorers, but his hat did.

102690.name: Eyestalk of C'Thun
102690.text: Taunt, Lifesteal Whenever your C'Thun gains Attack or Health, this does too (wherever it is).
102690.flavorText: C'Thun sees all...even next week's lottery numbers.

105563.name: Flame Lance
105563.flavorText: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.

102563.name: Flame Leviathan
102563.text: Rush When you draw this, deal 2 damage to all characters except Mechs.
102563.flavorText: Mimiron likes to take the Flame Leviathan out on some sweet joyrides.

102686.name: Future Emissary
102686.text: Battlecry: Reduce the Cost of all Dragons in your hand by (1). Give them +1/+1.
102686.flavorText: When Murozond attacked the past, Nozdormu sought help from the future, even journeying as far as the Forbidden Reach.

102560.name: Goblin Blastmage
102560.text: Battlecry: If you control a Mech, deal 6 damage randomly split among all enemies.
102560.flavorText: If you can't find a bomb to throw, just pick up any goblin invention and throw that.

102573.name: Grimestreet Enforcer
102573.text: At the end of your turn, give all minions in your hand +1/+1.
102573.flavorText: "Sir, you don't have a permit to park your mount here."

103234.name: Grimestreet Informant
103234.text: Battlecry: Discover a Hunter, Paladin, or Warrior card.
103234.flavorText: "Naw, naw. You're talkin' about Grime BOULEVARD. I ain't know nuthin' 'bout that."

102652.name: Grimy Gadgeteer
102652.text: At the end of your turn, give a random minion in your hand +2/+2.
102652.flavorText: "You look like a Gadgetgun 3000-Mark IV man, am I right?"

103223.name: Healing Wave
103223.text: Restore 8 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 16 instead.
103223.flavorText: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.

102661.name: Hobart Grapplehammer
102661.text: Battlecry: If you have a weapon equipped, give all minions in your hand and deck +2/+2.
102661.flavorText: Grapplehammer is the horrible mind behind the Automatic Piranha Launcher (banned in 7 districts)!

103216.name: Hooded Acolyte
103216.text: Taunt Whenever a character is healed, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
103216.flavorText: Wait, what kind of acolyte doesn't wear a hood?

106465.name: I Know a Guy
106465.flavorText: Well… a guy who knows a guy.

102689.name: Infinite Amalgam
102689.text: Inspire, Frenzy, Spellburst, Honorable Kill, and Overkill: Summon a random 1-Cost minion.
102689.flavorText: The Infinite Amalgam sought Gammy, the greatest among them, though it feared the queen of the amalgams would never be found.

102537.name: Invigorate
102537.text: Choose One - Gain an empty Mana Crystal; or Draw a card.
102537.flavorText: No. 3 Most Internally Contentious Hearthstone Card of 2022.

102658.name: Iron Juggernaut
102658.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Shuffle a Mine into your opponent's deck. When drawn, explode for 10 damage!
102658.flavorText: The Iron Juggernaut guards Orgrimmar and has just earned the "Employee of the Month" award!

103240.name: Ironforge Portal
103240.text: Gain 4 Armor. Summon a random 4-Cost minion.
103240.flavorText: Come to beautiful Ironforge! Where irons are forged and the forges are iron!

102572.name: Ivory Knight
102572.text: Battlecry: Discover a spell. Restore Health to your hero equal to its Cost.

102660.name: Ivory Rook
102660.text: Battlecry: Discover a Taunt minion. Gain Armor equal to its Cost.
102660.flavorText: Bringing back this cycle was risky, but the Ivory Queen thought it was worth the gambit.

103193.name: Jade Behemoth
103193.text: Taunt Battlecry: Summon a Jade Golem. Taunt Battlecry: Summon a Jade Golem.
103193.flavorText: I think we should talk about the jade elephant in the room.

102626.name: Jade Chieftain
102626.text: Battlecry: Summon a Jade Golem. Give it Taunt. Battlecry: Summon a Jade Golem. Give it Taunt.
102626.flavorText: Seeing his Jade Golem grow up into the tall, handsome 6/6 standing before him was the proudest moment of his life.

102624.name: Jade Lightning
102624.text: Deal 3 damage. Summon a Jade Golem. Deal 3 damage. Summon a Jade Golem.

102606.name: Jade Shuriken
102606.text: Deal 3 damage. Combo: Summon a Jade Golem. Deal 3 damage. Combo: Summon a Jade Golem.
102606.flavorText: Good news is, after you remove it from your wound, you can use it to pay your medical bills!

102662.name: Jade Spirit
102662.text: Battlecry: Summon a Jade Golem. Battlecry: Summon a Jade Golem.
102662.flavorText: "He's so cute! I just want to squeeze him, then use him for Jade Golem parts!" - Aya Blackpaw

102602.name: Jade Swarmer
102602.text: Stealth Deathrattle: Summon a Jade Golem. Stealth Deathrattle: Summon a Jade Golem.
102602.flavorText: He's so good at swarming, he can swarm all by himself!

102617.name: Jade Telegram
102617.text: Look at 3 cards in your opponent's hand and shuffle one of them into their deck. Summon a Jade Golem. Look at 3 cards in your opponent's hand and shuffle one of them into their deck. Summon a Jade Golem.
102617.flavorText: Golem-gram for Han'Cho! Golem-gram for Han'Cho!

102674.name: Kabal Courier
102674.text: Battlecry: Discover a Mage, Priest, or Warlock card.
102674.flavorText: Hey, you park your kodo under a harpy nest, you get what you deserve.

103203.name: Kabal Crystal Runner
103203.text: Costs (2) less for each Secret you've played this game.
103203.flavorText: "Listen, I can cut you in on a little of this premium mana, but you can't tell my boss."

103214.name: Keeper of Uldaman
103214.text: Battlecry: Set a minion's Attack and Health to 3.
103214.flavorText: U da man! No, U da man!

102981.name: King of Beasts
102981.text: Taunt Has +1 Attack for each other Beast you control.
102981.flavorText: He never sleeps. Not even in the mighty jungle.

102500.name: Klaxxi Amber-Weaver
102500.text: Taunt Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain +5 Health.
102500.flavorText: Amberweaving is a specialty course at the local trade school.

102523.name: Knight of the Wild
102523.text: Costs (1) less for each Beast you've summoned this game.
102523.flavorText: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.

103227.name: Krul the Unshackled
103227.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, summon all Demons from your hand.
103227.flavorText: Spicklefizz pondered his life choices as he looked at the chain around his neck. "Become a warlock," they said. "You get to enslave demons," they said.

102546.name: Lock and Load
102546.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, get a random Hunter card.
102546.flavorText: Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time. Lock and load." This card pays homage to that special moment.

103235.name: Lotus Agents
103235.text: Battlecry: Discover a Druid, Rogue, or Shaman card.
103235.flavorText: Mostly, they stand around and look cool.

102530.name: Malorne
102530.text: Deathrattle: Go Dormant. Revive after 2 friendly Beasts die.
102530.flavorText: When Malorne isn't mauling hordes of demons, he enjoys attending parties, though he prefers to go stag.

102556.name: Mana Wyrm
102556.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.
102556.flavorText: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

102688.name: Menagerie Jug
102688.text: Battlecry: Give 3 random friendly minions of different minion types +2/+2.
102688.flavorText: It's art imitating Battlegrounds imitating life.

102687.name: Menagerie Mug
102687.text: Battlecry: Give 3 random friendly minions of different minion types +1/+1.
102687.flavorText: He's a chip off the old jug.

103195.name: Menagerie Warden
103195.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly Beast. Summon a copy of it.
103195.flavorText: Please? Can I keep him? I promise to clean his cage every day.

103109.name: Mire Keeper
103109.text: Choose One - Summon a 2/2 Slime; or Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
103109.flavorText: "Hey.... Is that Mire for sale?" "No. I'm keeping it."

102614.name: Mount Hyjal Imposter
102614.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random 4-Cost minion that gains Stealth.
102614.flavorText: Among Tyrande's forces, Murozond had planted agents to ensure Archimonde's victory.

103231.name: Mukla's Champion
103231.flavorText: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.

102601.name: Murozond, Thief of Time
102601.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, Discover a Dragon. Deal damage equal to its Cost to all other minions.
102601.flavorText: By unwinding the fall of C'Thun, Murozond would claim the Old God's power, and with it, the world.

102590.name: Museum Curator
102590.text: Battlecry: Discover a Deathrattle card. It costs (1) less.
102590.flavorText: He is forever cursing the kids who climb on the rails and the evil archeologists who animate the exhibits.

103237.name: Mysterious Challenger
103237.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
103237.flavorText: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.

102591.name: Onyx Bishop
102591.text: Battlecry: Summon a random friendly minion that died this game.
102591.flavorText: B4 is a nice place to visit, but he wouldn't want to live there.

102632.name: Pebbly Page
102632.text: Battlecry: Draw an Overload card. You can't be Overloaded this turn.
102632.flavorText: A good friend will lighten your Overload.

103221.name: Poisoned Blade
103221.text: Your Hero Power gives this +1 Attack instead of replacing it.
103221.flavorText: How much more poisoned can a blade get? The answer is a lot. A lot more poisoned.

102532.name: Rat Sensei
102532.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add two 1/1 Turtles with Taunt to your hand.
102532.flavorText: The old teacher needed to find some tokens with attitude.

103238.name: Reincarnate
103238.text: Destroy a minion, then return it to life with full Health.
103238.flavorText: It's like birth, except you're an adult and you were just dead a second ago.

102580.name: Runi, Time Explorer
102580.flavorText: In the future, Xyrella's daughter would become a hero of time, but Nozdormu needed her now, for this moment.

102561.name: Servant of Yogg-Saron
102561.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell that costs (5) or MORE (targets chosen randomly).
102561.flavorText: Yogg-Saron always likes to complain about how he has too many servants and there are too many mouths to feed.

103219.name: Shado-Pan Rider
103219.flavorText: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

102598.name: Shadow Word: Forbid
102598.text: Tradeable Destroy a 4-Attack minion. Corrupt: Destroy ALL 4-Attack minions.
102598.flavorText: At last, Priest has no more weaknesses.

102596.name: Shadowbomber
102596.flavorText: Shadowbomber does her job, but she's kind of phoning it in at this point.

102595.name: Shadowfiend
102595.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).
102595.flavorText: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.

103197.name: Shaky Zipgunner
103197.text: Deathrattle: Give a random minion in your hand +2/+2.
103197.flavorText: The Grimy Goons can get you any weapon you want but if you want it to not explode you gotta pay extra.

102684.name: Shark Puncher
102684.flavorText: "And remember, if you come face-to-face with a shark, punch it in the nose." "Yes. Me punch you in nose with shark." "No, th- OW!"

102600.name: Ship's Chirurgeon
102600.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1 Health.
102600.flavorText: Knows the answer to every medical question except how to pronounce his name.

103217.name: Shrinkmeister
103217.text: Battlecry: Give a minion -3 Attack this turn.
103217.flavorText: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.

103212.name: Silvermoon Portal
103212.text: Give a minion +2/+2. Summon a random 2-Cost minion.
103212.flavorText: What's Millhouse Manastorm doing in Silvermoon?

102641.name: Silverware Golem
102641.text: If you discard this minion, summon it.
102641.flavorText: From the secret research labs of the Swiss Army.

102672.name: Sludge Belcher
102672.flavorText: DO NOT GIVE HIM A ROOT BEER.

106467.name: Small-Time Buccaneer
106467.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a weapon equipped.
106467.flavorText: "Oh, I'm not serious about it. I only pirate on the weekends."

105901.name: Smuggler's Crate
105901.text: Give a random Beast in your hand +2/+2.
105901.flavorText: Are you sure these are the crates that are supposed to go to the Gadgetzan petting zoo?

102541.name: Snipe
102541.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal 6 damage to it.
102541.flavorText: A great sniper hits the spot. Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

102558.name: Soot Spewer
102558.text: Spell Damage +1 Battlecry: If you control another Mech, get a random Fire spell.
102558.flavorText: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.

102692.name: Soridormi
102692.text: Dormant for 2 turns. When this awakens, reduce the Cost of all Dragons in your hand by (4).

102592.name: Spawn of Shadows
102592.text: Battlecry and Inspire: Deal 4 damage to each hero.
102592.flavorText: What did you expect to happen? He's a Spawn. Of Shadows.

105688.name: Spellslinger
105688.text: Battlecry: Both players get a random spell. Yours costs (2) less.
105688.flavorText: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about. Who can say?

102640.name: Spreading Madness
102640.text: Deal 13 damage randomly split among ALL characters.
102640.flavorText: Most citizens of Darkshire wear those surgical masks to prevent spreading Madness to tourists.

103213.name: Steward of Darkshire
103213.text: Whenever you summon a 1-Health minion, give it Divine Shield.
103213.flavorText: Turns out divine shields are way cheaper if you buy in bulk.

102654.name: Stolen Goods
102654.flavorText: It fell off a kodo, I promise!

106568.name: Street Trickster
106568.flavorText: His first trick: making your wallet disappear!

102618.name: The Scarab Lord
102618.text: Battlecry: Summon a 0/1 Gong for your opponent. Combo: Gain Rush.
102618.flavorText: What did it cost? 41,400 Silithid Carapace Fragments, to start.

102627.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
102627.text: Battlecry and Inspire: Give your Totems +2 Attack.
102627.flavorText: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating. I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

102552.name: Time-Lost Raptor
102552.flavorText: Much of his time lost no-lifeing Diablo IV.

102578.name: Timeless Blessing
102578.text: Give four random minions in your hand +4/+4, +3/+3, +2/+2, and +1/+1.
102578.flavorText: To defeat the combined power of Murozond and C'Thun, Nozdormu would need heroes of Azeroth's past, present, and future.

102685.name: Timeline Accelerator
102685.text: Battlecry: Draw a Mech. It costs (2) less.
102685.flavorText: The future is NOW! No wait, NOW!

102642.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
102642.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +2/+1.
102642.flavorText: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

105562.name: Tomb Pillager
105562.flavorText: After the guild broke up, he could no longer raid the tombs.

102633.name: Totally Totems
102633.flavorText: Hmph. Should've been Grace of Air Totem. Hmph.

102553.name: Trial of the Jormungars
102553.text: Summon copies of two Beasts in your deck that cost (3) or less.
102553.flavorText: The defendants were found guilty on 33 counts of wiping raid parties.

102623.name: Tuskarr Totemic
102623.flavorText: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.

102668.name: Twilight Geomancer
102668.text: Taunt Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +1/+1 and Taunt (wherever it is).
102668.flavorText: "Ok C'Thun, repeat after me: 'Your mother was a hamster.'"

102678.name: Twin Emperor Vek'lor
102678.text: Taunt Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, summon another Emperor.
102678.flavorText: Do they make decisions based on age? "I'm two minutes older therefore we burn this village."

103220.name: Undercity Huckster
103220.text: Deathrattle: Get a random card (from your opponent's class).
103220.flavorText: Psst! Wanna buy a random class card (from your opponent's class)?

103225.name: Usher of Souls
103225.text: Whenever a minion dies, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
103225.flavorText: Nothing unburdens your soul like a good ushing!

105693.name: Valstann Staghelm
105693.text: Deathrattle: Summon a Taunt minion from your deck.

102625.name: Wicked Witchdoctor
102625.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a random basic Totem.
102625.flavorText: You can easily defeat her by either dealing 4 damage, or dropping a house on her.

103215.name: Wickerflame Burnbristle
103215.flavorText: Wickerflame spent years as a recruit for the Goons, never making the big-time because he always fired his chest-cannon too slowly. "Hey," he thought, "maybe if I keep my beard lit on fire, I can do this faster." BOOM, promoted.

102647.name: Witch of the Arch-Thief
102647.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/3 Voidwalker with Taunt. If your opponent has more minions, repeat.
102647.flavorText: A minion fit for a king.

106578.name: Worgen Greaser
106578.flavorText: Hair products are 79% of his monthly budget.
